qas.question: Where is the first reference to the word Christian in the Bible?
Who made the second reference to the word Christian in the Bible?
When verse was the third mention?
In which book of the old testament is the first known usage of the term?
For how long did Antioch and Paul teach disciples?
Where was the fourth and final mention of the term?
In which book of the Old Testament does Paul reply to Herod Agrippa?
Where was Peter first called Christians?

context: The first recorded use of the term (or its cognates in other languages) is in the New Testament, in <a0_0><b3_0>Acts<b3_0/> 11:26<a0_0/>, after Barnabas brought Saul (Paul) to Antioch where they taught the disciples for <b4_0>about a year<b4_0/>, the text says: "[...] the disciples were called Christians first in <b7_0>Antioch<b7_0/>." The second mention of the term follows in <b6_0>Acts<b6_0/> 26:28, where <a1_0>Herod Agrippa II<a1_0/> replied to Paul the Apostle, "Then Agrippa said unto Paul, Almost thou persuadest me to be a Christian." The third and final New Testament reference to the term is in <b5_0>1 <a2_0>Peter 4:16<a2_0/>,<b5_0/> which exhorts believers: "Yet if [any man suffer] as a Christian, let him not be ashamed; but let him glorify God on this behalf."
